fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the assignee dropdown is a section called 'Suggested users'. Even if the user searching doesn't have the Browse users and groups Global permission, some users will appear as 'Suggested users'.

Interestingly, even if the users appear as suggested users, if you search for them, the search will return a message "No matches found" (the behavior we expect since the user doesn't have the Browse users and groups permission).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user who doesn't have permission to browse users and groups.
 # Go to > Filters > View all issues.
 # Select the assignee field. (Only those that are able to view the issue and be assigned are displayed)

h3. Expected Results

The expected result would be that it won't show the users as 'Suggested users'.
h3. Actual Results

Some users are being displayed as suggested users, and when you search for them, the search will return a message "No matches found". So, it seems this is a visual bug.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if you try to delete a Custom Field option via the Jira Users Interface and the option is being used in an issue then you will see the following message:

!image-2024-04-19-13-09-33-719.png|thumbnail!

But if you try to delete the same Option using REST API call [Delete custom field options|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-optionid-delete] it goes through without any verification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with Options, for any of:
 ** Checkboxes.
 ** Radio Buttons.
 ** Select List (single choice).
 ** Select List (multiple choices).
 ** Select List (cascading).
 # Assign the field to a screen.
 # Select a value in an issue.
 # Delete the Custom field option via REST API: [Delete custom field options|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-custom-field-options/#api-rest-api-3-field-fieldid-context-contextid-option-optionid-delete]

h3. Expected Results

Just like the Jira UI, to respond with an error stating that the option is being used by issues.
h3. Actual Results

The REST API successfully deletes the option without any verification.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing a status name results in an incomplete entry in the Audit log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Statuses catalog (Jira settings > Issues > Statuses)
 # Change the name of any status.
 # Go to the audit log and look for the change made.

h3. Expected Results

There is an entry in the audit log indicating a status was updated, with the original name and the new name indicated.
h3. Actual Results

There is an entry in the audit log indicating a status was updated, but it only indicates the new name, making it impossible to know what was the original status name.
h3. Workaround
 * Looking at existing workflows using that status and the transition names may help determine the original name.
 * You can try checking with project administrators and board users who are familiar with the expected steps in an issue and how they relate to a board column, as they might be able to share what the expected statuses should be mapped to each.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a file reference is added within a *Text Field (multi-line)* field (such as {*}Description{*}) in the same line with text and then copied to a Comment, the reference is incorrect. This leads to a *Failed to load / Something went wrong* error when the attachment is visualized or accessed from the comment.

This is not the case when the attachment is added in a new line.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule that copies the content from Description to a new comment.
 # Add a file to the description by dragging it to the field
 # Add text within the same line, evidence that the reference in the comment is broken
 # Repeat but add the file or text in a new line, evidence that the reference is now working.

h3. Expected Results

The smart field {{issue.description}} is returning a UUID instead of the actual file name and surrounding text.
h3. Actual Results

The smart field {{issue.description}} is returning a UUID instead of the actual file name when both Text and attachment are placed in one line.

 

Placed in one line: File is [^15bab28b-37ee-4af2-9c92-ae67f48da30e]
Placed in two lines: File is [^file1.numbers]

 

The same issue happens when getting the value through the v2 API

[https://<SITE_URL>/rest/api/2/issue/ISSUE_KEY|https://<>/rest/api/2/issue/SUP-792]
{code:java}
description "test3[^5cbb8ee3-54e9-4351-b40f-ce29ea595892]  1" {code}
 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Currently, It's not possible to add issues from other projects to Epic using the "Choose an existing issue link". It would be helpful to the customer if we could provide this feature. Please check the below screen-shot for your reference.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the REST API /rest/api/3/filter/\{id}/columns/  returns the wrong custom fields if there are multiple custom fields with the same name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with the name {{customfield_1}} (example cf id 1000)
 # Create a Filter which includes {{customfield_1}} and save the filter
 # Run the REST API call /rest/api/3/filter/\{id}/columns/ and you see the name of the column returns {{customfield_1 (id 1000)}}
 # Create a custom field with the same name {{customfield_1}} (example cf id 2000)
 # Add new custom field to to the previous filter 
 # This time when you run REST API call /rest/api/3/filter/\{id}/columns/ and you see the name of the column returns {{customfield_1}} but with the cf id 2000

h3. Expected Results

REST API should return {{customfield_1 (id 1000)}}
h3. Actual Results

REST API returns {{customfield_1 (id 2000)}}
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Note: This affects both REST API v2 and V3

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new [site admin users|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Enterprise-articles/Cloud-admins-we-re-saving-you-time-on-user-management/ba-p/2588292] in the centralized user management can't view or control the portal-only customers for Jira Service Management, which is an expected behavior. The error message displayed to the site admin needs to be improved.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/]. Select your organization if you have more than one.
 # Select *Products* from the header.
 # Under {*}Sites and Products{*}, select the site that contains Jira Service Management.
 # Under the *Jira Service Management* section on the nav bar, select {*}Portal customers{*}.
 # You will see an error of: Something went wrong(We had trouble trying to fetch your customers. Refresh the page to try again.)

h3. Expected Results

The error message shown should be {*}We're unable to let you in{*}(If you think you should have access, talk to an organization admin. [Learn more about admin roles|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/give-users-admin-permissions/])

!image-2024-04-08-16-22-17-901.png|width=270,height=226!
h3. Actual Results

The error message shown on UI: {*}Something went wrong{*}(We had trouble trying to fetch your customers. Refresh the page to try again.)

!image-2024-04-08-16-21-11-037.png|width=419,height=245!
h3. Workaround

The workaround is for site admins to reach out to org admins of the org to check if they can be given the privilege of org admins.

fields.description:
Currently, there are a few ways a user can connect products to Jira Cloud: [application links|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/use-applinks-to-link-to-atlassian-products/], [OAuth|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/integrate-with-self-hosted-tools-using-oauth/], [DVCS|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/connect-jira-cloud-to-bitbucket/#If-you--x27-re-connecting-a-Jira-Work-Management-project-] or using apps available on our Marketplace.

There is, however, no warning when the same connection is being duplicated (e.g. you've integrated Jira Cloud and Bitbucket Data Center through an application tunnel and via OAuth as an app), and this can lead to duplicated information and possible problems with sync, as some products have issues with multiple connections.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the "Hide From User Condition” in the workflow, the status is still visible to the customer, allowing them to manually transition the ticket even though they should not be able to do this when running transition automation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule to transition tickets from 1 status to another and then back to the original status.
 # Add the Hide From User Condition to the transition so that only the automation can make the change to the status. 

h3. Expected Results

When the automation rule to transition the ticket gets triggered, the hidden transition and the statuses attached to those transitions with the hide from user conditions should not appear. 
h3. Actual Results

When the automation rule is triggered and it starts making the change in the status for a few moments the status appears allowing the agent to click on it causing the automation to break
h3. Workaround

No workaround was found.

fields.description:
New DKIM signatures created for sending mail via Atlassian Cloud domains use 2048 bit DKIM signatures, however existing keys on some mail sending domains are still using 1024 bits.

Upgrade and rotate existing DKIM keys to 2048 bits.

A similar initiative for custom domains used with Atlassian Cloud products is tracked via [JRACLOUD-80123|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-80123].

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Date Picker not working for dates after 2031
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or edit an issue and set the Due Date to 12/31/2031 or any date after that.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should set the correct date.
h3. Actual Results

If you pick a date after 12/31/2031, it will yield a date from the early 1900s.

For example, picking 12/31/2032 yields 12/31/1932 when the field is saved.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira Cloud, when enabling the Atlas integration on Jira Product Discovery projects the "Atlas goals" field would be multiplied by the number of Jira Product Discovery projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enabling the Atlassian integration from the Jira Product Discovery project;
 # The Atlas system fields will be enabled in the project;
 # For each Jira Product Discovery project that has the Atlas integration enabled, there will be a correspondent field;
 # This results in multiple Atlas fields in the list;

!Atlas integration in JPD project settings-1.png!

!Atlas fields from JPD project settings-1.png!

!Atlas fields issue view-1.png!

!Issue search with many Atlas fields.png!

 

 
h3. Expected Results

A better way to visualize the Atlas fields is to avoid confusion when searching Jira issues. 
h3. Actual Results

The current multiple Atlas fields list makes it very hard to work on the issue search and filters.
h3. Workaround

There isn't a workaround at the moment.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is reproducible on Data Center: (no)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence space
# Create a test page
# Create a Jira project with one issue
# Go to the Jira issue and click on the dropdown next to the Link issue button, select Link Confluence page
# Provide the link to the Confluence home page
# Next, create a new link to the Confluence page
# Click on both links, one at a time, and compare the preview of the links

h3. Expected Results
Both previews will work.

h3. Actual Results
Only the preview to the Confluence page will work. The preview of the homepage will appear as follows. 
 !sample.png|thumbnail! 

The link located in the upper left corner of the pop-up will still work.

An error will appear on the Browser console
{code}
Content ID is undefined
{code}

h3. Further Context
Homepages are in the format {{https://<SITE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACE_KEY>/overview}}.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

comments.body:
Hello everyone,

This is Ben from the Confluence team. We would like to thank you for the report on the current need to be able to link Confluence home pages (sometimes also referred to as "Space Overview" pages) in Jira issues and have them load correctly. The current functionality is expected as this is a known issue with Embedded Confluence links; The team will be looking to address in the future.

Thanks,

Ben

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The suggestion relates to how pinning a field works today. At the moment, to be able to pin the field, you need to hover over the area in front of the field name, but to unpin it, you can hover over the name.

The suggestion is to make it homogeneous and either hover over the name for both actions (pin, unpin) or add an opaque pin icon in front of the name to identify the area, as it's done for the pinned field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue
 # Try pining the field by hovering over the name (no action)
 # Pin the file by hovering over the active area in front of the name

h3. Expected Results

-Have the same ability to pin and unpin the field the same way; show and un-show the pin icon the same way and have no variation to facilitate the task.
h3. Actual Results

-The action today is to pin the field; you have to hover over the active area in front of the field, and to unpin, you can hover over the name, which does not happen for pinning.

-What remains inconsistent is the way the icon
appears: it appears when hovering over the entire row to unpin, versus only
over the small, invisible icon area to pin.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Filter Results gadget, if the filter used isn't returning any issues the user will not be able to customize the columns for that gadget.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Filter Results gadget to a Jira Dashboard
 # Select a filter that returns no matching issues

Even if there are no matching issues at the moment users should be able to customize the columns that they want to display (just like it shows if there are matching results).

!image-2024-04-17-13-19-06-998.png!
h3. Actual Results

The column selection icon is not visible.

!image-2024-04-17-13-19-19-404.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A Connect app using {{jiraIssueTabPanels}} Connect module will receive the previous URL when clicking on the linked issue or a breadcrumb, if the panel is open from the previous issue.

This is very similar to
 * JRACLOUD-82861: Clicking the breadcrumb will send the previous issue URL for a jiraIssueContents Connect module

This issue also occurs if you have a Software Project and click on the breadcrumbs for parent issues.

This is likely caused by the Single Page Application nature of the way we refresh the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Connect app which uses {{jiraIssueTabPanels}}
{code:json}
    "jiraIssueTabPanels": [
      {
        "url": "/jira-page.html?issueId={issue.id}",
        "name": {
          "value": "JRACLOUD-83569 jiraIssueTabPanels"
        },
        "key": "jracloud-83569"
      }
    ]{code}
 # Install the Connect app in a Jira Work site
 # Create a Company Managed Project
 # Create two issues and link them
 # Click on *JRACLOUD-83569 jiraIssueTabPanels* to open the issue panel
 # Click on the linked Issue key to open the linked Issue

h3. Expected Results

The URL sent should be for the newly opened issue.
h3. Actual Results

The URL sent is for the previous issue.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page or close the tab before clicking on the linked issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is reproducible on Data Center: N/A

When migrating a single project to a site the first time using [C2C method|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/how-cloud-to-cloud-migration-links-data-between-sites/], the existing default context of the Story Points field is removed. 

!image-2022-06-02-17-59-02-954.png|width=495,height=280!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose a destination site where C2C migration has been performed yet.
 # In the source site, select a project and perform a C2C migration to the destination site. 
 # Go to *Settings > Issues > Custom fields > Story Points.* 
 # Click on the three dots:
 # !image-2022-06-02-18-01-32-429.png|width=210,height=258!
 # And check for the contexts present.

h3. Expected Results

The existing data, in this case, the Default context, should not be replaced or altered.
h3. Actual Results

The Default configuration has been removed.

!image-2022-06-02-17-59-02-954.png|width=387,height=219!
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

The user can manually update the context of the Story Points field manually after the migration has been completed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Jira can't attach files when creating issues with Microsoft OAuth incoming mail server if the file contains rich PDF content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Follow the steps in [Create issues and comments from email|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/create-issues-and-comments-from-email/] to add an incoming mail handler that uses a mail server with Microsoft OAuth.
 # Send an email with rich PDF content to the mailbox. (In our tests, the PDF file is over 12 MB with a lot of images)

h3. Expected Results
 * A new issue is created with the PDF file attached.

h3. Actual Results
 * A new issue is created without attachment. There is no indication that the file failed to be attached.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, starred or favorite dashboards can be accessed directly by clicking on the Dashboards menu in the navigation bar.
h3. Suggestion

It would be beneficial to have the ability to access a list of favorite dashboards from within a dashboard, similar to the feature in the Server environment. Having a list of favorite dashboards on the left-hand side that is always accessible would streamline the process of switching between them. This is particularly useful when working with numerous dashboards, as repeatedly clicking on the dashboard menu to switch can be time-consuming.

!favorite-dashboards.png!

fields.summary: Ability to view favorite dashboards within a dashboard

comments.body:
Closing this suggestion as Won't Fix.

The favourited dashboards are in the top navigation bar, under the Dashboards menu.

Placing the favourited dashboards in the top navigation bar would help the actual dashboard have more space to display data.

h3. Issue Summary
Suppose that a field of the *Select List (cascading)* type has more than 1000 options added to it. When you add this field to the issue view, only 1000 options are selectable in such a field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a field of *Select List (cascading)* type and add it to a screen
 # While creating a field, add more than 1000 options to it.
 # Open an issue and try selecting the 1001st option.

h3. Expected Results
The option should be available.

h3. Actual Results
The user sees the 'No matches found' error.

h3. Workaround
Add 1000 options only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is reproducible on Data Center: No
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a JQL with multiple word text searches, e.g.:
{code:java}
Text ~ "xxx" AND text ~ "yyy" AND status not in (Closed) ORDER BY updated DESC
 {code}
h3. Expected Results

The search to resolve and issues to be retrieved
h3. Actual Results

The search will fail with the error:
"An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."
h3. Workaround
 * Include a project clause if possible in all JQLs to narrow down the search scope
 * Escape-quote the text for an exact text match, for example text =~ "\"xxx\"" (see the two added {*}"{*}"). 
 * Refer to [this Community post |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-articles/Search-for-an-exact-phrase-with-JQL/ba-p/2131545]for more

fields.description:
h3. Description

Similar to JRACLOUD-79105, if you archive a project that have versions in there, the versions from the archived project will still be selectable when searching *fixversion* field Basic or JQL search.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a version in a software project. 
# Archive the project
# Open the fixVersion dropdown in Basic Search or type in JQL "fixVersion = "

h3. Expected Results
It will not bring the versions from the archived project as valid options

h3. Current results
It brings the versions from the archived project as valid options, but then return an error when running the search.

h3. Workaround
Users cannot have browse project permission to the archived project to not see them as options.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Jira administrator, I want to be able to use any field or a custom field of any type across all applicable features and functionality, because it's not expected that random fields or certain types of custom fields would be ignored or inaccessible.

Currently, we do have custom fields shared between these Projects, however, fields such as 'Story Points' (that is replaced by 'Story points estimate' in TM Projects), 'Flagged', 'Restrict To', and other similar fields that are not shared between them causing a difference in logic that could be quite complex for Jira administrators to explain to end-users.

The end goal is to not overcomplicate things and keep it simple, as performing X activity in a Company Managed project should have the same action as performing X activity in a Team Managed project, but with a reduced scope.
h3. Expected Results

The overall goal of this Feature is to simplify the difference in behavior between a Team-Managed and Company-Managed projects to facilitate Jira administrators to educate end-users. The minimum goal would be to have relevant *system fields* available for all projects, such as:
 * Story Points
 * Flagged
 * Restrict To
 * Others

h3. Actual Results

The difference between these fields for each type of Project creates an extra complexity for end-users, and the fields are not the same for Team Managed and Project Managed fields. 
h3. Workaround

N/A

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a use case where you need to add only a single special character (like - + * # etc.) as the issue's summary, it will not show up in the negative JQL searches.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with a dash in the summary:
!image-2024-04-15-14-56-29-981.png|width=341,height=65!
 # Try to search using the JQL and excluding some random text for the summary like the one below:

{code:java}
summary !~ "test" {code}

h3. Expected Results

As the issue's summary doesn't contain "test", it should show up in the results.
h3. Actual Results

The issue will not show up in the results.
h3. Workaround

You can use another string as a generic summary.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira iOS app does not render numbered lists correctly.

Numbered list in iOS:
 !WhatsApp Image 2024-04-15 at 19.28.34.jpeg|thumbnail! 

Numbered list in browser:
 !Screenshot 2024-04-15 at 19.28.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a divider in between each number in a numbered list
 # The iOS app will not render it correctly. The browser renders it correctly

h3. Expected Results
Both the browser and iOS app should render it correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The iOS app and the browser show different results.

h3. Workaround
Avoid using the divider

comments.body:
The expected behaviour shown in the web screenshot is actually different between older and newer versions of Jira web.

I'm able to reproduce the behaviour on jira.atlassian.com, but on a newer version of Jira web, the behaviour on web and mobile is the same - the list consistently resets at the divider for both.

Given the behaviour on Jira mobile matches newer versions of Jira web, I'm going to mark this as closed
Marking this as closed, as I can't reproduce the issue on the latest versions of Jira Web and Jira mobile - their behaviour is consistent.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Equal Operator ("=") in the Issue navigator doesn't find results for dates (Updated, Resolved, Target Start..)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Issue Navigator
 # Search for issues with updated dates for example
 # Check the date when a specific issue was updated
 **  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Query for issues which were updated on this specific date
 **  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Issue is found
h3. Actual Results

Issue is not found in the results
 * !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Workaround

Use a timestamp in the date value specified to ensure the full day is included. e.g.

Target Date > 2024-04-03 AND Target Date < 2024-04-02

Alternatively, you can use the {{endOfDay()}} function. The function takes an input which is a relative date specifier, so it may not be as useful

fields.description:
Currently there is only one Default Cloud Mail Server like <jira@<instance domain.atlassian.net>.

So, it's not possible to set multiple mail handlers for different project to create issue via email with Default Cloud Mail Server.

It would be nice if user can create multiple Default Cloud Mail Server to receive issue creation email for different project.
